sentences.en: a very prim and proper young lady
sentences.cn: 相当古板正经的年轻女子

sentences.en: But for all her modesty and restraint, she was not prim.
sentences.cn: 当时, 她在鱼和野生动物管理署的编辑职责已经开始增加.

sentences.en: Don't invite her to the party. She's so prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 别请她去舞会, 她太古板了.

sentences.en: He is prim and precise in manner.
sentences.cn: 他的态度一本正经而严谨.

sentences.en: May is always prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 梅总是很端正且很体面.

sentences.en: Meg is so prim she won't let me speak to him when we pass.
sentences.cn: 麦格又那么一本正经,我们对面穿过都不让我跟他搭腔.

sentences.en: Priscilla, you're being altogether too prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 普丽西拉, 你 真 是一本正经,一板一眼了.

sentences.en: She looked prim and nervous in her best hat and coat.
sentences.cn: 她戴着最好的帽子并穿着最好的外套，显得拘谨不安。

sentences.en: She's much too prim and proper to enjoy such a rude joke.
sentences.cn: 她太拘谨和正经,不会喜欢这种粗俗的笑话.

sentences.en: She's too prim to enjoy rude jokes!
sentences.cn: 她太古板,不喜欢听粗野的笑话!

sentences.en: The Prim Minister made a powerful speech which brought the house down.
sentences.cn: 首相发表了强有力的演说,博得了满堂喝彩.

sentences.en: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.cn: 她们矫揉造作,一本正经还撅着嘴.
他们娇揉造作地整洁打扮.

sentences.en: To me he looked to be sixty or seventy and excessively prim.
sentences.cn: 我看他有六七十岁了,古板之极.

sentences.en: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 我们倾向于把维多利亚时代的人想象得非常古板、中规中矩。

sentences.en: You can't tell her that joke—she's much too prim and proper .
sentences.cn: 你可别跟她讲那个笑话，她这个人古板正经得要命。

sentences.en: You can't tell that joke to her she's much too prim and proper.
sentences.cn: 可别给她讲那样的笑话 -- 她这人过于古板和认真.

words.tran_cn: 初期；青年；精华；全盛时期
初级读本；识字课本；原始物

phrases.tran_cn: 循规蹈矩的；一本正经的

trans.tran_cn: 循规蹈矩的，整洁的，（人）一本正经
trans.tran_en: prim clothes are neat and formal

trans.tran_cn: (Prim)人名；(法、德、匈、捷、瑞典、西、葡)普里姆
使显得一本正经；把…打扮得整整齐齐
